description:
One of the very first nebulae I ever actually saw an image. Have always wanted an image of it ever since. Luckily the skies in Chile offer some *excellent* views of this target. I've dumped quite a few days into editing this. Starting off with an HaRGB image, before finishing that image and realizing I thought it would be better if I added L to the image. 

Initially, the Ha was so noisy after intense stretching that sharpening it became quite dirty and resulted in a ton of artifacts. I opted to keep the halo, and go for a much more mild sharpness. I was getting ready to post it when I realized that maybe just using the L data for the sharpness and Ha for the giant halo might give me the best of both worlds, so that's what you see here! 

The L data added many more stars to the image, and made them a bit larger. That was one thing I quite liked about the HaRGB version, was the stars were pretty small and much fewer in number. However, I think I did a well enough job controlling them when combining the L that I didn't get rid off too much of that feel it gave the image. 

Overall, very pleased with how this came out. I am looking forward to completing an SHO version of the image as well. Given the similarities of this target already though to the Hubble palette, I am thinking I may get a little experimental with the colors. 

Stay tuned, and clear skies!
title: The Helix Nebula / The Eye of God
